item.title: Cyber Insights 2025: Identities
item.dc:creator: Kevin Townsend
item.description:
Both human and machine identities occupy a unique position: they are simultaneously the foundation of cybersecurity and its weakest link.

The post Cyber Insights 2025: Identities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Moves for the week of January 13, 2025 - SecurityWeek
item.description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of January 13, 2025. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.

item.title: Biden Executive Order Aims to Shore Up US Cyber Defenses
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
President Joe Biden issued an executive order aimed at strengthening the nation’s cybersecurity and making it easier to go after foreign adversaries or hacking groups.

The post Biden Executive Order Aims to Shore Up US Cyber Defenses appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Data From 15,000 Fortinet Firewalls Leaked by Hackers
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Hackers have leaked 15,000 Fortinet firewall configurations, which were apparently obtained as a result of exploitation of CVE-2022–40684.

The post Data From 15,000 Fortinet Firewalls Leaked by Hackers appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: 2024 US Healthcare Data Breaches: 585 Incidents, 180 Million Compromised User Records
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
In 2024 organizations informed the US government about 585 healthcare data breaches affecting a total of nearly 180 million user records.

The post 2024 US Healthcare Data Breaches: 585 Incidents, 180 Million Compromised User Records appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Head of US Cybersecurity Agency Says She Hopes It Keeps up Election Work Under Trump
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
Jen Easterly hopes CISA is allowed to continue its election-related work under new leadership despite “contentiousness” around that part of its mission.

The post Head of US Cybersecurity Agency Says She Hopes It Keeps up Election Work Under Trump appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: FBI Uses Malware’s Own ‘Self-Delete’ Trick to Erase Chinese PlugX From US Computers
item.dc:creator: Ryan Naraine
item.description:
Law enforcement turns the PlugX malware’s own self-delete mechanism against it, nuking the China-linked trojan from thousands of US machines.

The post FBI Uses Malware’s Own ‘Self-Delete’ Trick to Erase Chinese PlugX From US Computers appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: DORA’s Deadline Looms: Navigating the EU’s Mandate for Threat Led Penetration Testing
item.dc:creator: Trevin Edgeworth
item.description:
With DORA’s January 2025 compliance deadline approaching, financial institutions must embrace rigorous testing, tailored threat profiles, and continuous vigilance to safeguard against cyber threats.

The post DORA’s Deadline Looms: Navigating the EU’s Mandate for Threat Led Penetration Testing appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Cyber Insights 2025: Open Source and Software Supply Chain Security
item.dc:creator: Kevin Townsend
item.description:
Open source software (OSS) is a prime target for supply chain cyberattacks and protecting it remains a major challenge.

The post Cyber Insights 2025: Open Source and Software Supply Chain Security appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Google OAuth Flaw Leads to Account Takeover When Domain Ownership Changes
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
A vulnerability in Google’s OAuth implementation allows takeover of old employee accounts when domain ownership changes.

The post Google OAuth Flaw Leads to Account Takeover When Domain Ownership Changes appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Chrome 132 Patches 16 Vulnerabilities
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Google has released Chrome 132 with fixes for 16 vulnerabilities, including multiple high-severity security defects.

The post Chrome 132 Patches 16 Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.
